> I just wanted to stop junit testing until certain key input is entered.

JUnit is about automated testing. If you try to bold some interactiveness
on, you're probably using it wrong.

> public class CalculatorTest extends TestCase {

Are you using JUnit3 tests on purpose?
 
>  protected void setUp() throws Exception {
>   super.setUp();
>  }
> 
>  protected void tearDown() throws Exception {
>   super.tearDown();
>  }

Even if you do, you don't need to override these methods if you just 
call the base class' implementation.
  
>      [exec] com.example.calculator.test.CalculatorTest:.
>      [exec] Error in testManual:
>      [exec] java.lang.NumberFormatException: unable to parse 'null' as
> integer

Maybe ant messes with stdin.

> Do you let me know what i want to do?

Seriously, I don't know what you want to do, but without knowing your background it seems like a bad idea.

Robert
